qas.question: What is the decolonization of the Americas?

answers.text: the process by which the countries in the Americas gained their independence from European rule.

qas.question: When did the decolonization of the Americas begin?
When did the wars against Spanish rule occur?
What were the Spanish wars directly linked to?
How did the Spanish conflict begin?

answers.text: short-lived governing juntas established in Chuquisaca and Quito opposing the composition of the Supreme Central Junta of Seville.

context: The decolonization of the Americas was <a0_0>the process by which the countries in the Americas gained their independence from European rule.<a0_0/> Decolonization began with a series of revolutions in the late <a1_0>18th and early-to-mid-19th centuries.<a1_0/> The Spanish American wars of independence were the numerous wars against Spanish rule in Spanish America that took place during the early 19th century, from <a2_0>1808 until 1829<a2_0/>, directly related to the <a3_0>Napoleonic French invasion of Spain.<a3_0/> The conflict started with <a4_0>short-lived governing juntas established in Chuquisaca and Quito opposing the composition of the Supreme Central Junta of Seville.
